description: From dialectal German Sisschen, Zeischen, diminutive form of Middle High German zisec, apparently ultimately from Proto-Slavic *čižь (compare e.g. Polish czyżyk).

entries.meaning: A small green and yellow European finch, Carduelis spinus spinus or Carduelis spinus, now Spinus spinus.
examples: I sat there on a bench in dappled shade, beside an aviary full of brightly feathered finches and siskins fluttering about.

entries.meaning: Any of various similar birds in subfamily Carduelinae, principally in the genus Spinus.
